sentences.english: "More than any other subject, weight is delicate, " Maddison said.
sentences.chinese: “體重問題比其他問題都要微妙，”麥迪遜說。

sentences.english: Florals are for middle-aged women with weight problems.
sentences.chinese: 大花圖案都是爲那些有體重問題的中年婦女所準備的。

sentences.english: And, of course, get down to your ideal body weight.
sentences.chinese: 最後，當然還有減至理想體重。

sentences.english: It can lift 10 times its bodyweight: two tons.
sentences.chinese: 它能舉起10倍於自身體重的物體。

sentences.english: The dog's height should not exceed 40 cm, weight 10 kg.
sentences.chinese: 狗的身高不能超過40釐米，體重在10公斤以下。

sentences.english: You may have heard that some foods, because they are difficult to digest, will make you lose weight.
sentences.chinese: 你一定聽說過那些難消化所以會使你體重減輕的食品。

sentences.english: It was found that the gain of body weight of the high Se group was significantly lower than that of adequate Se group.
sentences.chinese: 結果發現高硒飼料組大鼠的體重明顯低於適硒飼料組。

sentences.english: He initially tried to eat more to gain weight, but it had no effect.
sentences.chinese: 最初，他試着喫多喫來增加體重，不過完全無效。

sentences.english: At his death, he had lost about a third of his weight and had only a few dollars.
sentences.chinese: 他死時，體重銳減約三分之一，而且身上只剩幾文錢。

sentences.english: She tried to reduce her weight.
The researchers also studied the number of people who are said to be underweight in different countries.
sentences.chinese: 研究人員還研究了不同國家被視爲體重不足者的人數。

sentences.english: Last week I gained another five pounds.
sentences.chinese: 上週我體重又增加了五磅。

sentences.english: Kirstie has been up and down the scale many times, and right now she is on an upswing.
sentences.chinese: 柯斯迪的體重一直上下波動，現在體重有上升趨勢。

sentences.english: Kirstie has been up and down the scale many times, and right now she is on an upswing.
sentences.chinese: 柯斯迪的體重一直上下波動，現在體重有上升趨勢。

sentences.english: If you want to lose weight, here are some dos and don'ts.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想減輕體重，這是一些注意事項。

sentences.english: A girl told me donating blood would make her gain weight. Not true.
sentences.chinese: 有位姑娘告訴我，獻血會使她的體重增加，這不正確。

definition: to absorb (nutrients etc)/to assimilate/intake/to take a photograph of (a scene)
to lower/to decrease/to reduce/to subtract/to diminish
to save food/to go on a diet
to put on weight/to get fat
